subject: Programming
title: Microservices Architecture
description: Learn Microservices Architecture in one minute.

hook.text: One giant application becomes impossible to change. Split it into small, independent services.

buildup.text: Microservices let teams deploy, scale, and update each service independently without touching others.

discovery.text: Netflix, Amazon, and Spotify use microservices to ship features fast across massive platforms.

twist.text: Microservices trade one big problem for many small ones: networking, consistency, and debugging across services.

climax.text: Start with a monolith. Split only when you've outgrown it. Premature microservices create premature complexity.

quiz.question: When should you adopt microservices?
options: When the monolith becomes too hard to change
